columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the response headers policy.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The identifier for the response headers policy.

columns.name: arn
columns.description: The version identifier for the current version of the response headers policy.

columns.name: last_modified_time
columns.description: The date and time when the response headers policy was last modified.

columns.name: type
columns.description: The type of response headers policy, either managed (created by AWS) or custom (created in this AWS account).

columns.name: etag
columns.description: The version identifier for the current version of the response headers policy.

columns.name: response_headers_policy_config
columns.description: A response headers policy contains information about a set of HTTP response headers and their values. CloudFront adds the headers in the policy to HTTP responses that it sends for requests that match a cache behavior thatâ€™s associated with the policy.
